options schema buildJsDocs DataInvalidError DataItemsError DataRangeError DataRequiredError DataTypeError OptionsError Skemer #validateAdd #validateNew SchemaError validateAdd validateNew

options(schema, [baseSchema], [replace])

Options Object that must be passed to the one-off validate functions and on creating an instance of a Skemer

Parameters

  • schema schema :

    Schema to use for the validation

  • [schema] baseSchema :

    Schema to be used for recursive schemas. If none given, the given, the full schema given in schema will be used

  • [boolean or Array<boolean>] replace :

    A boolean to specify whether to globally replace all existing values for arrays and objects, or an object of string/boolean key/value pairs used to specify what variables(their name given as the key) should have their value replaced by default (a boolean value of true)

schema([doc], [docType], [noDocDig], [type], [types], [values], [multiple], [object], [regex], [min], [max], [replace], [required], [default])

Schema Object detailing the schema to be used for validating and merging data.

Parameters

  • [string] doc :

    A String giving information on the value expected

  • [string] docType :

    A string containing the type of the value expected that will be used instead of calculating the type of value expected

  • [boolean] noDocDig :

    If set and the value expected is an object, buildJsDoc will not document the parameters of the object

  • [string or or Array<schema>] type :

    The value type of the parameter expected

  • [Array<schema>] types :

    An Array or Object of schema containing different schemas of the values expected

  • [Array] values :

    Specifies the possible values for strings, numbers and dates

  • [boolean] multiple :

    Whether or not multiple values (stored in an Array, or if object is set totrue` an Object) are allowed. Can be a boolean, a number (the number of values that the value expected must have), or an array containing the minimum number of values and, optionally, the maximum number of values.

  • [boolean] object :

    If multiple is true and object is true, the multiple values will be stored in an object. If multiple is true and object is false, any keys will be ignored and the values will be stored in an array

  • [RegExp] regex :

    A regular expression to validate a String value

  • [number or date] min :

    The minimum number, string length or number of Array elements required

  • [number or date] max :

    The maximum number, string length or number of Array elements allowed

  • [boolean] replace :

    Whether a new value should completely replace an old value when the value expected is either an array or an object

  • [boolean or Function or number or Array<number>] required :

    Either true/false or a function returning true/false whether the parameter is required, or if the variable is a multiple stored in an array an number given the number of required elements, or an array of numbers, the first being the minimum number of elements and the second being the maximum number of elements (a maximum is not required)

  • [Any] default :

    Default value to use if no value is given

buildJsDocs(schema, options)

Build a JSDoc for a variable using the given schema.

Parameters

  • Object schema :

    An Object containing a valid schema

  • Object options :

    An Object containing build options

    • [string] options.name

      Name of the object documenting (will be prepended to any parameter names

    • [string] options.type (default 'prop')

      Specify what block tag should be used for the variables

    • [number] options.tabWidth (default 8)

      The width (number of characters) of a tab

    • [string] options.preLine

      String (normally indentation) to include before each line

    • [boolean] options.lineup (default true)

      Whether to line up text in a JSDoc block (eg @param) with the end of the block command

    • [number] options.wrap

      Number of characters to wrap the JSDoc lines at

Returns

string :

A string containing the JSDoc for the given schema

DataInvalidError(message, extra)

Thrown if the parameter value is not valid

Parameters

  • string message :

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

DataItemsError(message, extra)

Thrown if the parameter value is out of the given range

Parameters

  • string message :

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

Thrown if the parameter value is out of the given range

Parameters

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

DataRequiredError(message, extra)

Thrown if a parameter is required, but was not given

Parameters

  • string message :

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

DataTypeError(message, extra)

Thrown if the type of value for a parameter in the schema is incorrect,

Parameters

  • string message :

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

Skemer(options)

Skemer prototype to enable simple reuse of a schema

Parameters

  • Object options :

    An object containing the validation options, including the schema

Instance members

#validateAdd(data, newData)

Add new data to existing validated data based on the stored schema. NOTE: Existing data WILL NOT be validated

validateAdd(data, newData)

Add new data to existing validated data based on the stored schema. NOTE: Existing data WILL NOT be validated

Parameters

  • Any data :

    Existing data to merge new data into.

  • ...Any newData :

    Data to validate and merge into the existing data.

Returns

Any :

Validated and merged data

#validateNew(newData)

Validate and merge new data based on the stored schema.

validateNew(newData)

Validate and merge new data based on the stored schema.

Parameters

  • ...Any newData :

    Data to validate, merge and return. If no data is given, a variable containing any default values, if configured, will be returned.

Returns

Any :

Validated and merged data

SchemaError(message, extra)

Thrown if the parameter value is out of the given range

Parameters

  • string message :

    Error message

  • Any extra :

    Extra information

validateAdd(options, data, newData)

Validata and add new data to existing validated data based on the given schema. NOTE: Existing data WILL NOT be validated

Parameters

  • Object options :

    An object containing the validation options, including the schema

  • Any data :

    Data to validate and return. If no data is given, data containing any default values will be returned. If newData is given, newData will be validated and merged into data.

  • ...Any newData :

    Data to validate and merge into data

Returns

Any :

Validated and merged data

validateNew(options, newData)

Validate and merge new data based on the given schema.

Parameters

  • Object options :

    An object containing the validation options, including the schema

  • ...Any newData :

    Data to validate, merge and return

Returns

Any :

Validated and merged data
